Class Layer

java.lang.Object
neuralnetwork.Layer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Function<org.jblas.DoubleMatrix,org.jblas.DoubleMatrix>
public class Layer extends Object implements Function<org.jblas.DoubleMatrix,org.jblas.DoubleMatrix>, Serializable
A layer of the neural network.

  • Constructor Details

    • Layer

      public Layer(double[] vector, LayerArchitecture ld, ActivationFunction af, Layer sub)
      Creates a neural layer from a vector
      Parameters:
      vector - The vector of all the weights and biases for the neural network.
      ld - The architecture for this layer.
      af - The activation function for this layer.
      sub - The sublayer of this layer.

  • Method Details

    • hasSubLayer

      public boolean hasSubLayer()
      Does this layer have a sublayer?
      Returns:
      True if the layer has a sub layer, false otherwise.

    • wIsWeight

      public void wIsWeight(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix grad, Layer.BackTrackResult btr)
      This is for calculates the the partial derivative with respect to weights in this layer.
      Parameters:
      grad - The uncompleted gradient.
      btr - The result of previous layers.

    • grad

      public Layer.BackTrackResult grad(Datum x)
      The gradient of this layer as a function of the weights and biases applied to x.
      Parameters:
      x - The point the neural network is being applied to. For the purposes of computing the gradient, this is considered a constant.
      Returns:
      The of this method and the result of applying the layer to x. In the gradient vector, each row is the gradient over all the weights and biases for one of the highest layer nodes.

    • affineTransf

      public org.jblas.DoubleMatrix affineTransf(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix vec)
      The affine transformation defined by the wieghts matrix times vec plus the bias. Wx+b.
      Parameters:
      vec - The vector to undergo transformation. The vector is not changed.
      Returns:
      A new vector that is the val of the affine transformation applied to vec.

    • apply

      public org.jblas.DoubleMatrix apply(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix vec)
      Specified by:
      apply in interface Function<org.jblas.DoubleMatrix,org.jblas.DoubleMatrix>

    • operand

      public org.jblas.DoubleMatrix operand(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix x)
      The operand of this layer. If the layer has a sublayer, then this is sublayer applied to x, otheriwse it is just x.
      Parameters:
      x - The datum the neural network is applied to.
      Returns:
      The operand of this layer.

    • setWeights

      public void setWeights(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix weights)
      Sets the weights of the layer. Each row of the proffered matrix is the weights of a single node. TODO:Use this instead of generating new layers.
      Parameters:
      weights - The weights of the nodes. Each row is the weights for a single node.

    • setBias

      public void setBias(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix bias)
      Sets the biases of the layer. TODO:Use this instead of generating new layers.
      Parameters:
      bias - The new biases of the layer. Each value is the bias of a a single node, whose weights are correspond to the nodes on the same rows of the weights matrix.

    • numNodes

      public int numNodes()
      The number of nodes in this layer.
      Returns:
      The number of nodes in this layer.
